Questions.QuestionString: The APU magnetic chip detector is located: (Level 1)
Answers: On the generator oil scavange line

Questions.QuestionString: What component in the oil system is controlled by ECB? (Level 1)
After replacing ECB: (Level 2)
Answers: The APU hours and cycles must be updated through MCDU
The DMM automatically reinitializes the new ECB with the old accumulated APU data
The DMU automatically reinitializes the new ECB with the old accumulated APU data

Questions.QuestionString: When does the APU air intake ‘Flap Open’ message disappear on lower ECAM during shutdown? (Level 3)
Answers: As soon as MASTER SW in `OFF` position
As soon as APU bleed SW in ‘ OFF’ position

Questions.QuestionString: APU air intake duct supplies the air for: (Level 1)
Answers: the APU load compressor operation only.
the APU engine operation and the APU load compressor operation.

Questions.QuestionString: Inlet guide vanes(IGVs) control: (Level 1)
Answers: the amount of air supplied to the load compressor.
the amount of air supplied to the APU engine.
the amount of air supplied to the load compressor and the amount of air supplied to the APU engine.

Questions.QuestionString: How many ways the APU can be manually shut down: (Level 1)
You shut down the APU from outside the airplane: (Level 2)
Answers: the APU cools down for a period of time before shutting down.
no way to shut down APU from outside.

Questions.QuestionString: Operating limits that can trigger an automatic shutdown are: (Level 1)
Answers: low oil pressure or high oil temperature.

Questions.QuestionString: APU fuel pump: (Level 2)
Answers: runs only if no tank boost pump feeds the APU feed line.
run continuously when the APU is operating.
the APU has no own fuel pump.

Questions.QuestionString: The IGV actuator uses: (Level 3)
Answers: high pressure fuel to operate the inlet guide vanes.
high pressure air to operate the inlet guide vanes.
high pressure hydraulic fluid to operate the inlet guide vanes.

Questions.QuestionString: There is a switch labeled FUEL VENT PUSH is installed on the APU compartment forward firewall: (Level 3)
Answers: to allow maintenance to start the APU.
to allow maintenance to operate the APU fuel pump and purge the fuel line from the APU compartment.
to allow maintenance staff to shut down the APU in case of emergency.

Questions.QuestionString: The APU oil cooler is: (Level 3)
The APU is ready to supply load, when RPM (round per minute) is at: (Level 3)
Which component controls and monitors the APU operation: (Level 3)
the APIC APU bleed control valve is: (Level 2)
With the APU bleed valve open, releasing the master switch will cause the APU to shut down: (Level 3)
Answers: Only after the cool down period has elapsed
Only if the START pushbutton is released

Questions.QuestionString: The high oil temperature or low oil pressure detected during APU operation, the ECB will cause the APU to shut down: (Level 3)
Answers: Only if the MASTER switch is released
Only after the cool down period has elapsed

Questions.QuestionString: What kind of design is the turbine for APU? (HONEYWELL 131-9) (Level 1)
Which component regulates the airflow to the pneumatic system? (Level 2)
Which of the following components are operated by high pressure fuel from the FCU (GTCP 36-300)? (Level 3)
Answers: Inlet guide vane actuator and Surge control Valve
Inlet guide vane actuator and Load bleed valve

Questions.QuestionString: What are the three APU modules? (Level 2)
How the APU Generator is lubricated? (Level 2)
Answers: Using the common oil system with the APU.
By design APU Generator is self lubricated.

Questions.QuestionString: When the APU Master switch is set to ON, the APU (Low pressure) fuel pump will run: (Level 3)
Answers: Only when the START pushbutton is pressed
Only if a low fuel pressure is detected

Questions.QuestionString: Which statement below is correct? (Level 3)
Answers: The ECB and DMM should not be replaced at the same time.
DMMs should be swapped between APUs and aircraft for trouble shooting.
The DMM should not be replaced alone because it is dedicated to the certain APU.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the purpose of the Oil Temperature Sensor? (Level 3)
Answers: Used for high oil temperature protection and de-oiling during cold weather starts.
To protect APU against high oil temperature conditions.

Questions.QuestionString: What is only component in the oil system controlled by ECB? (Level 1)
Which component(s) is (are) actuated by the servo fuel? (Level 2)
Answers: APU bleed control valve actuator and IGV actuator
APU surge control valve and IGV actuator
APU bleed control valve actuator and APU surge control valveactuator

Questions.QuestionString: Press and hold the APU fuel line vent pushbutton: (Level 2)
Answers: APU pump runs and fuel LP valve opens
APU pump runs and fuel LP valve opens if master switch is “ON”
APU pump runs and fuel LP valve opens if the external power is connected to the aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: The primary function of the load compressor is: (Level 1)
Answers: To provide bleed air for the combustion
To provide air for oil and compartment cooling
To provide bleed air for the A/C pneumatic system

Questions.QuestionString: It is possible to do an EMERGENCY shutdown of the APU from: (Level 2)
Answers: The external power control panel on the lower fuselage (108VU).

Questions.QuestionString: The surge control valve: (Level 2)
Which statement is correct regarding the ignition system in APU APIS 3200 ? (Level 2)
Answers: Single alternating system with 2 igniter plugs

Questions.QuestionString: The starter motor assists the APU up to which speed? (Level 2)
What is the purpose of the APU: (Level 1)
Answers: to supply the aircraft the pneumatic and electrical power.
to supply the aircraft the pneumatic and hydraulic power.
to supply the aircraft the electrical and hydraulic power.

Questions.QuestionString: APU air inlet supplies the air for: (Level 1)
Answers: the APU load compressor operation only.
the APU engine operation and the APU load compressor operation.

Questions.QuestionString: Which computer controls and monitors the APU operation: (Level 2)
What is the purpose of the FUEL VENT PUSH pushbutton installed on the APU compartment forward firewall: (Level 2)
Answers: to allow maintenance to operate the APU fuel pump and purge the fuel line from the APUcompartment provided the APU Master Switch is ON.
to allow maintenance to operate the APU fuel pump and purge the fuel line from the APU compartment without the APU Master Switch ON.
to allow maintenance to shut down the APU in case of emergency.

Questions.QuestionString: A bleed control valve is installed to prevent the load compressor from the surge. On which engine the valve is installed (Level 3)

The solenoid valve is open during start-up to 60% when: (Level 3)

WHEN APU PROTECTIVE SHUTDOWN, ECB STRAR APU SHUTDOWN: (Level 2)

Load control valve and surge control valve

Questions.QuestionString: Above 20,000 ft, the APU can supply: (Level 2)

After replacement of the ECB: (Level 2)

Questions.QuestionString: To purge the APU fuel line using push button switch VENT: (Level 3)

APU fuel pump is manually turned on

Questions.QuestionString: The APU start sequence is initiated by the: (Level 3)

The Load Bleed Valve and the Inlet Guide Vane Actuator

Questions.QuestionString: From where the APU emergency shut down can be initiated? (Level 3)

External power panel and Cockpit only.
External power panel only, if the aircraft is on ground.

Questions.QuestionString: What is(are) operating limit(s) that can trigger an automatic shutdown of the APU: (Level 3)

Questions.QuestionString: What is the right statement: (Level 3)
Answers: the APU pump runs only if no tank boost pump feeds the APU feed line.
the APU pump runs continuously when the APU is operating.
the APU has no own boost pump.

to allow maintenance staff to operate the APU fuel pump and purge the fuel line from the APU compartment.
to allow maintenance staff to shut down the APU in case of emergency.

Questions.QuestionString: What is the un-latch sequence of fasteners for APU access doors? (Level 3)
Before starting APU, what is item that you must check outside APU? (Level 3)
Answers: There is FOD near air intake.

Answers: Yes, if there is sufficient extinguishing.

Questions.QuestionString: The surge control valve of APU is: (Level 2)

APU is running but can not supply electrical power

Questions.QuestionString: Which statement is correct during APU APIS 3200 start sequence: (Level 3)

2 ignitor plugs operate at the same time

Questions.QuestionString: With APU bleed valve open,  releasing the master sw will cause the APU to shut down: (Level 3)
Answers: Never,  the APU bleed control valve must be shut first
Only after the cool down period has elapsed

Questions.QuestionString: How is the IGV system controlled? (Level 1)
In case of failure on ground, how can you open or close the air intake flap? (Level 2)
Answers: The air intake flap actuator cannot be overridden.
The air intake flap actuator can be hydraulically overridden.
The air intake flap actuator can be overridden by a Manual Override Device.

Questions.QuestionString: The APU oil cooler is used to remove heat from the oil system: (Level 1)
Answers: When oil temperature is high enough
When oil temperature is cold enough

Questions.QuestionString: Generally,  during APU operation: (Level 1)
Answers: The electric power supply has priority over the bleed air supply
The bleed air supply has priority over the electric power supply

Questions.QuestionString: In the APU fuel system the ECB controls: (Level 1)

The fuel metering valve and 3 way solenoid valve
The fuel metering valve,  the pressure regulator valve and 3 way solenoid valve

Questions.QuestionString: When the apu master sw is set to on, the apu fuel pump will run : (Level 1)
Answers: Only if low fuel pressure is detected
Only if L/H wing pumps are not running
As soon as when START pushbutton is pressed

Questions.QuestionString: Generally , during apu operation : (Level 1)
Answers: The electric power supply has priority over the bleed air supply
The bleed air supply has priority over the electric power supply

Questions.QuestionString: What is the main function of the APU? (Level 1)
Answers: To produce independent pneumatic and hydraulic power.
To produce independent pneumatic and electrical power.
To produce independent electrical and hydraulic power.

Questions.QuestionString: The APU is: (Level 1)
Answers: Two shaft assembly interconnected through a gearbox

Questions.QuestionString: The Electronic Control Box has : (Level 1)

Answers: Push and hold the VENT P/B at the APU compartment.
Push and hold the VENT P/B with the master switch selected ON.

APU page, on sight glass located on the gear box

APU speed 99 %, SCV closed, load valve opened

Questions.QuestionString: Incase APU has an automatic shut down, information of the shut down in:(Level 2)

The APU start (to rotate) sequence is initiated by the:(Level 1)

Answers: low oil pressure or high oil temperature
low oil pressure, high oil temperature or excessive EGT

Questions.QuestionString: How many mount GTCP36-300 attach to aircraft is:(Level 2)
APU air intake has:(Level 1)
Answers: One air intake flap installed in the top left area of the tail cone.
One air intake flap installed in the forward lower area of the tail cone.
Two air intake flap installed in the top right area of the tail cone.

Questions.QuestionString: IGV actuator , Bleed and surge control valve operate by:(Level 2)
How many igniter plug intalled on APU(GTCP36)?(Level 1)
How many fuel atomizer in combustion system(GTCP36)?(Level 1)
Turbine in power section (GTCP36) consist of:(Level 1)
Manual cranking plug installed on:(Level 1)
Answers: Oil tank pad under of the gearbox.
Air/oil seperator pad in right hand side of the gearbox.
Starter in font of the gearbox

Questions.QuestionString: After crank APU shaft for BSI, we need:(Level 1)
Answers: Install plug and do leak check.
Install cranking plug, Install/replace new performed packing BSI Port and do leak check.

Questions.QuestionString: The 131-9A APU is:(Level 1)
The APU installed in:(Level 1)
Answers: A fireproof compartment between FR80 and FR84 forward of aircraft
A pressurized compartment between FR80 and FR84 rear of aircraft
A fireproof compartment between FR80 and FR84 rear of aircraft

Questions.QuestionString: Engine system includes:(Level 1)
Answers: Power section, load compressor and accessory gear box.
Power section, load compressor, load turbine and accessory gear box.
Power section, load compressor, conbustor, load turbine and accessory gear box.

Questions.QuestionString: How many valve/main component in APU 131-9 bleed system?(Level 1)
Answers: 3 (Bleed and surge control valve, IGV actuator )

Questions.QuestionString: 131-9 Load compressor include:(Level 3)
Answers: Single-stage centrifugal compressor with a 7,5 : 1 pressure ratio.
Single-stage centrifugal compressor with a 4 : 1 pressure ratio.

Questions.QuestionString: Combustion system (131-9) is:(Level 3)
Turbine in power section (131-9) consist of:(Level 1)
Purpose of Inlet guide Vane is:(Level 1)
Answers: Control the compressor output to the aircraft pneumatic system.
Modulate airflow coming from inlet plenum to Power section compressor.
Modulate airflow coming from inlet plenum to Power section turbiner.
